p: There is not report in the literature about cytotoxic activity of the essential oil of A. suaveolens front of A. salina. However, the high toxicity observed (8.90 μg.mL -1) can be related to the synergism between monoterpenes and sesquiterpenes, present in the essential oil from A. suaveolens. Studies pro Boscardin et al. [ 31] on cytotoxic activity of volatile oil Eucalyptus benthamii in four tumor lines showed that the essential oil showed better results than the single compounds (α-pinene and γ-terpinene) to Jurkat, HeLa, and B16F10 cells.
